item.title: Transmission start-up script for slackware.
item.description: I installed transmission on a headless server so I need it to start on boot. The included start-up script was dependent on start-stop-daemon that is mission on Slackware. The examples on the transmission forums were ok but would resulted in transmission running as root and I want it to run as a non-privileged user. So I modified an example script to read like this: #!/bin/bash #Slackware startup deamon script # Name of Service NAME="Transmission Daemon" # Command to run CMD="/usr/bin/transmission-daemon" # Option to run with deamon # -a means from where to accept incoming connections, comma separated # you may want to add your local network if you have multiple clients OPTIONS="-a 127.
